relevance_rule.rule_text: All abstracts that have client provided keywords

keywords: Dialysis Outcomes and Practice Patterns Study

relevance_rule.reasoning: This rule explicitly states that relevance is determined by the presence of client provided keywords.

priority_rules.rule_text: Phase 2 data, Phase 3 data (including meta-analyses), real-world data (including PROs and registry data), Phosphate binders/phosphate lowering treatment; EXCLUDE Ardelyx sponsored abstracts
priority_rules.reasoning: This rule requires both keyword matching for phases and treatments, and context for real-world data and meta-analyses. Ardelyx sponsored abstracts are excluded to ensure mutual exclusivity with the Internal priority.

priority_rules.rule_text: Ardelyx sponsored abstracts; EXCLUDE Phase 2, Phase 3, meta-analyses, real-world data, PROs, registry data, Phosphate binders/phosphate lowering treatment
priority_rules.reasoning: This rule is based on sponsorship keyword and excludes all High priority concepts to maintain exclusivity.

priority_rules.rule_text: Phase 1 data, retrospective analyses, prognostic studies, trial designs, preclinical studies; studies with trial outcomes and endpoints; other general studies; EXCLUDE Ardelyx sponsored abstracts, Phase 2, Phase 3, meta-analyses, real-world data, PROs, registry data, Phosphate binders/phosphate lowering treatment
priority_rules.reasoning: This rule covers a broad set of study types and outcomes, requiring both keyword and context matching, and excludes higher priority concepts for exclusivity.

priority_rules.rule_text: All abstracts that only have mention of an indication and does not include any other data; EXCLUDE Ardelyx sponsored abstracts, Phase 1, Phase 2, Phase 3, meta-analyses, real-world data, PROs, registry data, Phosphate binders/phosphate lowering treatment, retrospective analyses, prognostic studies, trial designs, preclinical studies, trial outcomes, endpoints, general studies
priority_rules.reasoning: This rule requires semantic/contextual analysis to determine if only an indication is mentioned without any supporting data, and excludes all higher priority concepts.
